result.execSummary:
The defendant KAREN A DUKET was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: -To be paid to the Clerk of Courts office.  Monies are to be paid during the first year of probation.  Failure to pay may result in the suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

-Restitution in the amount of $150.00 for case number 2022CM11 is to be collected as a condition of probation on this case. To be paid to the probation office. Monies are to be paid during the first year of probation.  Failure to pay may result in the suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

-Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent including any counseling and/or treatment and follow-up as recommended. 
-Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  You may be randomly tested for compliance. 
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. KAREN A DUKET

defendant.name: DUKET, KAREN A
defendant.address: 571 Cty Rd A, C/O Green Lake County Jail, Green Lake, WI 54941

records.addlTxt:
2:04 PM Defendant KAREN A DUKET in court, in custody.  Attorney Michael J Kapelis in court for KAREN A DUKET.  Attorney Matthew Steven McElroy in court for State of Wisconsin. Court recites agreement - defendant will plea to count 1 in 2022CF28 with probation and conditions & 2 in 2022CF88 with jail, costs and DNA sample and counts 3 & 4 and 2022CM11 will be dismissed and read-in and State is requesting restitution in 22CM11 with defense free to argue. ADA concurs. Atty Kapelis concurs. Defendant concurs.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant. Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights. Court goes over the elements of each offense. Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty. Court instructs defendant regarding deportation. (If felony) Court instructs regarding felony prohibitions. 

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST. Court finds the plea is made knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently. Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea. Court finds the defendant guilty on counts 1 & 2 as charged and orders counts 3 & 4 and 2022CM11 be dismissed and read-in. Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today. ADA confirms compliance with victim witness rights. Sentencing statement by ADA. Sentencing statement by Atty Kapelis. No statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

COUNT 1

-SWD, and places the defendant on probation for 3 years.

CONDITIONS:

-Court costs. To be paid to the Clerk of Courts office.  Monies are to be paid during the first year of probation.  Failure to pay may result in the suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency. 
-Restitution of $150.00 for 2022CM11.
-AODA and any follow-up, if recommended by the Agent. 
-Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent including any counseling and/or treatment and follow-up as recommended. 
-Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  You may be randomly tested for compliance. 
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample. 

COUNT 2

-6 months county jail, to commence immediately. No huber, out of county service or travel.
-Court costs. Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or call the Clerk of Courts Office (920-294-4142) to set-up a payment plan. 
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample. 

Court grants the defendant 127 days of sentence credit on count 2.

Court adjourned at 2:18 PM
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 7, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Letter to Judge Slate from Atty Michael Kapelis dated 08.26.2022 re: request for earlier court date
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 13, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Pre-Trial Status Report
Return date on September 12, 2022 at 10:30 am.

11:32 AM Defendant KAREN A DUKET in court, in custody.  Attorney Scott Nelson appeared by video for KAREN A DUKET.  Attorney Matthew Steven McElroy in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant will waive her right to a preliminary hearing. Court instructs the defendant regarding his/her right to a preliminary examination. Defendant waives his/her right to a preliminary examination. Court finds probable cause. Court accepts the waiver of the prelim and binds the defendant over for trial. 

State files an information with the court. Attorney Nelson acknowledges receipt of the information and waives any reading. Atty Nelson enters a plea of Not Guilty on behalf of the defendant. Court will set both cases for Return Date on September 12, 2022 at 10:30 AM.

Court adjourned at 11:35 AM
Preliminary hearing on June 13, 2022 at 11:30 am.

10:15 AM Defendant KAREN A DUKET in court, in custody.  Attorney Michael J Kapelis in court for KAREN A DUKET.  Attorney Gerise Laspisa in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls 2022CF88  & 2022CM11. Atty Kapelis represents the defendant on 2022CF88 and defendant qualifies but does not know if he will be appointed on 2022CM11. Statement by Atty Kapelis regarding modification of bond. Argument by DA Laspisa regarding bond. Court denies the motion. 

Court adjourned at 10:19 am

Court will set 2022CF88 for Preliminary Hearing on June 13, 2022 at 11:30 AM and status on 2022CM11.
Motion hearing on May 24, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Defendant's Motion to Modify Bond

Atty Kapelis confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading and requests preliminary hearing. Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count.
